title: Prepare an OpenShift project for UD/UCMDB
content:
Before installing the containerized UD/UCMDB, you need to create an OpenShift project.

Create an OpenShift project

  1. Log in to your OpenShift Container Platform.
  2. Go to Home > Projects, and then click Create Project.
  3. Enter a name in the Name field. For example, ucmdb-prod.
  4. Click Create to create a deployment for UD/UCMDB.

Check the UID and GID

You will need to check and take notes of the user ID (UID) and group ID (GID) in the project so that later you can use UID and GID when configuring NFS volumes and defining your custom values.yaml file.

  1. Go to Home > Projects, and then select the project created for the UD/UCMDB deployment. For example, ucmdb-prod.
  2. Click Details, and then click the edit icon under Annotations.
  3. Check the UID and GID values. For example:  
    openshift.io/sa.scc.uid-range=1000590000/10000
openshift.io/sa.scc.supplemental-groups=1000590000/10000
  4. Take notes of the UID and GID, and then click Save. You will need to use the UID and GID later when you Configure NFS volumes for UD/UCMDB and Create my-values.yaml.

Create the registry pull secret

Run the following command to create the registry pull secret.

Note: Run this command in the bastion node rather than in the OpenShift platform.
kubectl create secret docker-registry registrypullsecret -n <namespace> --docker-server=<image repository URL>  --docker-username=<username> --docker-password=<password>

Where:

  • <namespace>: Use the project name that you specify when creating the OpenShift project in the first step. For example, ucmdb-prod.
  • <image repository URL>: Specify the image registry URL.
  • <username>: Use the registry username.
  • <password>: Use the registry-admin password.
